title: GSA enters $1B OneGov cloud agreement with AWS
summary: The General Services Administration announced a $1 billion 'OneGov' cloud agreement with Amazon Web Services on July 18, 2025, creating unprecedented vendor concentration in federal cloud infrastructure. The deal centralizes government cloud services under a single provider, raising concerns about dependency risks, competitive fairness, and potential conflicts given Amazon's relationships with the administration.
notes: This massive single-vendor contract raises antitrust concerns and creates critical dependency on Amazon for federal operations. The deal follows GSA's mass layoffs and restructuring under the Trump administration.

sources.title: GSA enters into $1B OneGov cloud agreement with AWS
Amazon inks $1 billion cloud deal with U.S. government
